section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Regulation, unless the context otherwise requires—
section.def: dangerous drug (危險藥物) means a dangerous drug within the meaning of the Dangerous Drugs Ordinance (Cap. 134);
disciplinary offence (違紀行為) means a disciplinary offence under section 17(3) or 18;
officer (人員) means a correctional services officer;
Superintendent (監督) means an officer appointed under section 3(2)(a) to assist the Commissioner in the administration of a rehabilitation centre.

subsection.content: The Commissioner shall have the general charge and control of all rehabilitation centres.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: appoint for each rehabilitation centre an officer to be Superintendent of the centre to assist him in the administration of the centre;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: appoint for each rehabilitation centre an officer to be Officer-in-charge of the centre; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: appoint such other officers as he may consider necessary for services in rehabilitation centres.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Reception of offenders
section.content: The Commissioner shall, upon delivery to him of a detention order, cause to be made all necessary arrangements for the reception of the offender named in the detention order.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Medical examination
section.content: Every offender shall, on the day of his admission or as soon as possible after his admission to a rehabilitation centre, be separately examined by a medical officer.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Personal record of offenders
section.content: Every offender shall, as soon as possible after his admission, be interviewed by the Officer-in-charge, who shall, with reference to rule 12 of the Prison Rules (Cap. 234 sub. leg. A), cause to be entered in the offender’s record such personal particulars as the Officer-in-charge considers necessary.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Classification
section.content: The Commissioner shall classify all offenders, having regard to their character, previous history and other relevant circumstances and shall arrange for each offender to receive his training at the rehabilitation centre which is, in the opinion of the Commissioner, most suitable.

subsection.content: Offenders shall be divided into such grades as the Commissioner may approve.
The privileges of each grade shall be specified by the Commissioner.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Diet
section.content: Every offender shall be supplied with food in accordance with scales of diet as the Chief Executive may approve from time to time.

subsection.content: Every offender, unless excused by a medical officer on medical grounds, shall from the beginning of his sentence be engaged in suitable work calculated to assist his reintegration into society on discharge.
No offender shall be engaged in any work unless he has been certified by a medical officer to be fit for work of that description.
An offender upon his release from a rehabilitation centre, may receive a cash grant in accordance with an earnings scheme approved by the Commissioner.

The Officer-in-charge may, if satisfied that an offender belongs to a religious denomination, if the offender so desires and it is reasonably practicable to do so, make arrangements for the offender to attend appropriate religious services.

The Officer-in-charge may, if satisfied that an offender belongs to a religious denomination or has a genuine need for religious instruction, if the offender so desires and it is reasonably practicable to do so, make arrangements for the offender to receive appropriate religious instruction.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Board to make recommendations for offender’s promotion and discharge

subsection.content: The Commissioner shall appoint for each rehabilitation centre a Board of Review consisting of the Superintendent and the Officer-in-charge of the centre and such other officers as the Commissioner may select, to watch the behaviour of each offender and to make recommendations for his promotion to a higher grade and discharge.
The Board shall cause an offender to be brought before it once a month or as more frequently as the Board considers necessary during his detention.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Functions of Board
section.leadIn: The functions of a Board shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to assess each offender’s progress and make recommendations to the Commissioner concerning the offender’s promotion to a higher grade;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to make recommendations to the Commissioner in respect of the transfer of an offender to a training centre or prison;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to make recommendations to the Commissioner relating to the release of any offender having regard to the objective of securing the offender’s rehabilitation and his reintegration into society, and the need to protect the public from potential harm from the offender.

subsection.content: A supervision order against an offender shall be read and explained to, and served on, the offender by the Officer-in-charge before the offender is released from a rehabilitation centre.
Where a condition of a supervision order against an offender is varied, the varied order shall be read and explained to, and served on, the offender by the Officer-in-charge.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Conditions of a supervision order
section.content: Conditions that may be specified for inclusion in a supervision order may relate to matters referred to in Schedule 1.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Procedures relating to drug tests
section.content: Where an offender is required under a condition of a supervision order to supply a urine specimen for drug test, the procedures to be followed by officers are those set out in Schedule 2.

subsection.content: The Commissioner may grant to an offender permission to be absent from a rehabilitation centre for a period not exceeding 5 consecutive days at any one time.

An offender permitted to be absent under subsection (1) shall be given a pass signed by the Commissioner stating the period during which the offender is permitted to be absent from the rehabilitation centre and the address at which the offender is required to reside during his absence.

An offender who, without reasonable excuse, fails to return to the rehabilitation centre at or before the expiration of the period for which he has been granted leave shall be guilty of a disciplinary offence.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Disciplinary offences
section.content: An offender who commits any of the offences enumerated in rule 61 of the Prison Rules (Cap. 234 sub. leg. A) as applied by section 12 of the Ordinance shall be guilty of a disciplinary offence.

section.name: s19
section.heading: Investigation of disciplinary offences, and awards, by Superintendent

subsection.content: Every allegation of a disciplinary offence shall be reported forthwith to the Superintendent and the Superintendent shall investigate every report of such an offence not later than the following day, unless that day is a public holiday.

subsection.leadIn: If, upon investigation, the Superintendent determines that the disciplinary offence is proved, he shall make one or more of the following awards—

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: forfeiture of privileges for a period not exceeding 1 month;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: deduction from earnings of the cost of any Government property lost or wilfully damaged.

subsection.def: For the purpose of subsection (2), privileges (特惠) shall be taken to include association, games and entertainment.

subsection.content: An offender may appeal to the Commissioner against a determination or an award made by the Superintendent under subsection (2) within 48 hours after the making of the determination or award, as the case may be, by giving notice in writing to the Superintendent, who shall forthwith notify the Commissioner and stay execution of the determination or award pending the outcome of the appeal.

The Commissioner may confirm, vary or reverse the determination or award against which the appeal is made or may substitute for such award any other award which the Superintendent was competent to make under subsection (2).

section.name: s20
section.heading: Report
section.content: No report under section 19 against an offender shall be dealt with by an officer of the rehabilitation centre except the Superintendent.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Offenders may be kept apart pending adjudication of disciplinary offence
section.leadIn: When an offender has been reported for a disciplinary offence, the Officer-in-charge may order him to be kept apart from other offenders, pending adjudication if and only if he is satisfied—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that such order is necessary to prevent collusion between the offender concerned and other offenders in respect of the disciplinary offence in the interest of the administration of justice; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that such order is necessary to protect the offender concerned from potential harm from other offenders, or vice versa.

section.name: s22
section.heading: Offenders given opportunity to defend against allegation of a disciplinary offence
section.content: An offender shall, before a report is dealt with, be informed of the disciplinary offence for which he has been reported and shall be given an opportunity of hearing the facts alleged against him and of being heard in his defence.

section.name: s23
section.heading: Forms
section.content: The forms set out in Schedule 3 shall be used for the purposes specified therein.

tr.td: Conditions in a supervision order may include conditions relating to the offender’s—
supplying his urine specimen for drug test if required;
being or not being at a specified place at certain days or time of a day;
refraining from associating with persons who have any connection with the offence for which he was sentenced or with any other offence of which he was convicted; and (L.N. 245 of 2001)
refraining from visiting any place connected with the offence for which he was sentenced or with any other offence of which he was convicted. (L.N. 245 of 2001)

section.name: s1
section.content: Where an offender is reasonably suspected to have abused any dangerous drugs during the period when he is subject of a supervision order, the officer who has been designated to supervise him may, after obtaining endorsement from the Superintendent, require the offender to supply a urine specimen for drug test.

section.name: s2
section.content: The officer shall serve a notice in Form 8 of Schedule 3 on the offender in the presence of a witness who may be a family member of the offender or another officer.

section.name: s3
section.content: If the offender upon whom a notice has been served does not wish to give consent for supplying a urine specimen, he may indicate so in the acknowledgment form attached to the notice and make written representations to the Commissioner stating his reasons why the requirement is considered not justified within 48 hours after his receipt of the notice.

section.name: s4
section.content: The Commissioner shall decide, having regard to all relevant circumstances, whether the offender is required to supply his urine specimen and the decision of the Commissioner shall be final.

section.name: s5
section.content: The offender shall be informed of the decision of the Commissioner.

schedule.text: Rehabilitation Centres Regulation(Cap. 567 sub. leg. A)NOTICE TO SUPPLY URINE SPECIMEN FOR TESTING

tr.td: 1. By virtue of section 16 of the Rehabilitation Centres Regulation (Cap. 567 sub. leg. A), you,
(name of offender) are required to supply your urine specimen to . (name of officer) for testing upon receipt of this notice.
2. If you do not consent to supply a urine specimen for testing, you may make a written representation to the Commissioner of Correctional Services within 48 hours after receipt of this notice.
3. The Commissioner of Correctional Services will decide whether you are required to act in accordance with this notice and his decision is final. You will be informed of the decision.
4. You will be in breach of a condition of the supervision order if you refuse to act in accordance with the decision of the Commissioner of Correctional Services.
